attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The id property represents the control's identifier.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-type
attributes.description: Type of the control.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-is-attached
attributes.description: Returns a boolean value which determines if the control is logically attached to the dom.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-virtual-control-right-mappings
attributes.description: Allows a mapping of virtual rights to real rights.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-access-config
attributes.description: Holds the config of the access configuration.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-class-names
attributes.description: Defines the classes the control is part of. These can be addressed in themes.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-color
attributes.description: Definition of the background color which is used if no or a transparent Background image is set.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-is-enabled
attributes.description: Only enabled controls will react on events.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-tooltip
attributes.description: Specifies a tooltip for this control.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-border-color
attributes.description: Color of the border.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-left
attributes.description: Specifies the distance between the left margin edge of the control and the left edge of its containing control. Could be empty if width and right is set.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-left-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-top
attributes.description: Specifies the distance between the top margin edge of the control and the top edge of its containing control. Could be empty if height and bottom is set.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-top-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-right
attributes.description:
If both left and right are specified, and width is empty, both the left and right distances are respected.
In all other situations, if width is constrained in any way, the left property takes precedence and the right attribute is ignored.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-right-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-bottom
attributes.description:
If both top and bottom are specified, and height is empty, both the top and bottom distances are respected.
In all other situations, if height is constrained in any way, the top property takes precedence and the bottom attribute is ignored.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-bottom-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-width
attributes.description: Outer width of the control. If this is empty left and right will be used to calculate the size.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-width-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-height
attributes.description: Outer height of the control. If this is empty top and bottom will be used to calculate the size.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-height-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-opacity
attributes.description: A number between 0 (not visible) and 1 (full visible).

attributes.name: data-tchmi-visibility
attributes.description: The visibility property can be used to hide (still receives pointer events) or collapse (does not use space or receive pointer events) an element and its childrens. Hidden still uses space in fluid calculations, collapsed is ignored there.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-transform
attributes.description: A way to scale, rotate, translate and/or skew a control.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-width-mode
attributes.description: Defines if the width is taken from the width value or calculated from left and right (parent).

attributes.name: data-tchmi-height-mode
attributes.description: Defines if the height is taken from the height value or calculated from top and bottom (parent).

attributes.name: data-tchmi-max-width
attributes.description:
Maximal width of the control.
max-width overrides width, but min-width overrides max-width.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-max-width-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-max-height
attributes.description:
Maximal height of the control.
max-height overrides height, but min-height overrides max-height.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-max-height-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-min-width
attributes.description:
Minimal width of the control.
max-width overrides width, but min-width overrides max-width.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-min-width-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-min-height
attributes.description:
Minimal height of the control.
max-height overrides height, but min-height overrides max-height.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-min-height-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-grid-column-index
attributes.description: Column index of the control inside a TcHmiGrid container.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-grid-row-index
attributes.description: Row index of the control inside a TcHmiGrid container.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-zindex
attributes.description:
The z-index property specifies the z-order of a Control.
When controls overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other.
A control with a larger z-index generally covers a control with a lower one.

Note: Reordering controls via document outline works, too, without touching any z-index.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-rendered-left
attributes.description:
Returns the pixel distance between the left margin edge of the control and the left edge of its containing control.
These numbers will probably have rounding errors!

attributes.name: data-tchmi-rendered-top
attributes.description:
Returns the pixel distance between the top margin edge of the control and the top edge of its containing control.
These numbers will probably have rounding errors!

attributes.name: data-tchmi-rendered-right
attributes.description:
Returns the pixel distance between the right margin edge of the control and the right edge of its containing control.
These numbers will probably have rounding errors!

attributes.name: data-tchmi-rendered-bottom
attributes.description:
Returns the pixel distance between the bottom margin edge of the control and the bottom edge of its containing control.
These numbers will probably have rounding errors!

attributes.name: data-tchmi-rendered-width
attributes.description:
Returns the outer pixel width of the control.
These numbers will probably have rounding errors!

attributes.name: data-tchmi-rendered-height
attributes.description:
Returns the outer pixel height of the control.
These numbers will probably have rounding errors!

attributes.name: data-tchmi-border-width
attributes.description: Width of the border of the control.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-border-style
attributes.description: Defines the style of the border. Valid values are 'Solid', 'Dashed', 'Dotted', 'None'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-border-radius
attributes.description: Border radius for rounded corners.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image
attributes.description: An image in the background which is rendered over a background color.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-width
attributes.description: Width of the background image.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-width-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-height
attributes.description: Height of the background image.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-height-unit
attributes.description: Could be 'px' or for relative positioning '%'.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-horizontal-alignment
attributes.description: Position of the background image.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-vertical-alignment
attributes.description: Position of the background image.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-background-image-padding
attributes.description: Padding of the background image.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-box-shadow
attributes.description: Defines the box shadows.

access.name: operate
access.description: Controls the ability to operate. This defaults to true.

access.name: observe
access.description: Controls the ability to observe. This defaults to true.

attributeCategories.name: Colors
attributeCategories.description: All color definitions concerning this control.

attributeCategories.name: Layout
attributeCategories.description: Attributes defining the position and size of a control.

attributeCategories.name: Layout (rendered)
attributeCategories.description: Rendered size and position values in pixel.

attributeCategories.name: Border
attributeCategories.description: Attributes defining the border of the control.

attributeCategories.name: Background Image
attributeCategories.description: Attributes defining a background image of the control.

events.name: .onAttached
events.description: The attached event is fired before a control is added to a view.

events.name: .onDetached
events.description: The detached event is fired after a control was removed from a view.

events.name: .onResized
events.description: The resized event is fired after a control was resized.

events.name: .onMoved
events.description: The moved event is fired after a control was moved.

events.name: .onInitialized
events.description: The initialized event is fired after a control is initialized. Note that not all Binding values are available at this time.

events.name: .onDestroyed
events.description: The destroyed event is fired after a control is destroyed. Note that the control itself is not available anymore at this time.

events.name: .onMouseOver
events.description: The mouseover event is fired when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved onto the element that has the listener attached or onto one of its children.

events.name: .onMouseEnter
events.description:
The mouseenter event is fired when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved over the element that has the listener attached.
Does not trigger on children.

events.name: .onMouseDown
events.description:
The mousedown event is fired when a pointing device button (usually a mouse button) is pressed on an element.
Note: This Event is fired at a touch screen, too. To prevent this set 'preventDefault' on the correspondent touch event.

events.name: .onMouseDownLeft
events.description:
The mousedownleft event is fired when the main interaction botton (most left) of a pointing device button (usually a mouse button) is pressed on an element.
Note: This Event is fired at a touch screen, too. To prevent this set 'preventDefault' on the correspondent touch event.

events.name: .onMouseDownRight
events.description: The mousedownright event is fired when the secondary interaction botton (most right) of a pointing device button (usually a mouse button) is pressed on an element.

events.name: .onMouseMove
events.description: The mousemove event is fired when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved while over an element.

events.name: .onMouseUp
events.description:
The mouseup event is fired when a pointing device button (usually a mouse button) is released over an element.
Note: This Event is fired at a touch screen, too. To prevent this set 'preventDefault' on the correspondent touch event.

events.name: .onMouseUpLeft
events.description:
The mouseupleft event is fired when the main interaction botton (most left) of a pointing device button is released over an element.
Note: This Event is fired at a touch screen, too. To prevent this set 'preventDefault' on the correspondent touch event.

events.name: .onMouseUpRight
events.description: The mouseupright event is fired when the secondary interaction botton (most right) of a pointing device button is released over an element.

events.name: .onMouseClick
events.description: The mouseclick event is fired when a pointing device button (usually a mouse button) is pressed and released on a single element.

events.name: .onMouseRightClick
events.description: The mouserightclick event is fired when the right button of the mouse is clicked (before the context menu is displayed)

events.name: .onMouseDoubleClick
events.description: The mousedoubleclick event is fired when a pointing device button (usually a mouse button) is clicked twice on a single element.

events.name: .onMouseOut
events.description: The mouseout event is fired when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved off the element that has the listener attached or off one of its children.

events.name: .onMouseLeave
events.description: The mouseleave event is fired when a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved off the element that has the listener attached.

events.name: .onMouseWheel
events.description: The wheel event is fired when a wheel button of a pointing device (usually a mouse) is rotated.

events.name: .onTouchStart
events.description: The touchstart event is fired when a touch point is placed on the touch surface.

events.name: .onTouchMove
events.description: The touchmove event is fired when a touch point is moved along the touch surface.

events.name: .onTouchEnd
events.description: The touchend event is fired when a touch point is removed from the touch surface.

events.name: .onTouchCancel
events.description: The touchcancel event is fired when a touch point has been disrupted in an implementation-specific manner (for example, too many touch points are created).

events.name: .onPressed
events.description: The pressed event is fired after a click (mouse) or tap (touch) event.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-creator-visibility
attributes.description: Defines if the Control is visible while engineering.

attributes.name: data-tchmi-creator-locked
attributes.description: Defines if the Control is locked (not changeable with the keyboard/mouse) while engineering.
